meanings.definition: A sample or preview of something to come.
meanings.sent1: The small bite of cake was a delightful foretaste of the delicious dessert to follow.
meanings.sent2: The movie trailer gave us a foretaste of the exciting action scenes in the film.
meanings.sent3: Trying on the superhero costume was a funny foretaste of the upcoming costume party.
meanings.sent4: The first raindrop was a foretaste of the impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The fresh scent of flowers in the garden provided a pleasant foretaste of spring.

meanings.definition: To experience or anticipate something before it actually happens.
meanings.sent1: She could foretaste the joy of winning the race as she crossed the finish line.
meanings.sent2: The students eagerly foretasted the upcoming field trip to the zoo.
meanings.sent3: He couldn't help but foretaste the excitement of his surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent4: The chef could foretaste the delicious flavors of the dish before even tasting it.
meanings.sent5: The traveler could foretaste the adventure awaiting him in the unexplored jungle.
